content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: iPhone App Transcribes Speech Into E-Mail, SMS
entries.snippet: Dragon Dictation is a speech recognition app for the iPhone that simplifies the process of composing emails and text messages by transcribing spoken words into text. Users activate the app, press the record button, and speak; their speech is then sent to Nuance’s servers, where it is processed and converted into text. The transcription appears quickly, and users can edit it by deleting inaccurate words. The transcribed text can then be copied into an email, SMS, or clipboard. The app performs well in terms of speed and accuracy, although it censors explicit language. Dragon Dictation is available for free for a limited time on the App Store.

entries.title: SpeechUT: Bridging Speech and Text with Hidden-Unit for Encoder-Decoder Based Speech-Text Pre-training
Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
entries.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

v.title: AudioPaLM: A Large Language Model That Can Speak and Listen
Best text-to-speech software of 2025
v.snippet:
This document from TechRadar (dated September 29, 2025) presents a comprehensive guide to the best text-to-speech (TTS) software of 2025. It emphasizes the growing importance of TTS for accessibility, productivity, and content creation, particularly in media like YouTube and podcasting.

The top picks include:

1. **NaturalReader** – Best overall for personal/home use, offering 56 voices across 9 languages and cloud-based access.
2. **Murf** – Best for realistic AI voices, ideal for e-learning and presentations, with advanced editing and voice-changing tools.
3. **Amazon Polly** – Best for developers, offering easy API integration and broad language support.
4. **Play.ht** – Best for podcasting, providing nearly 600 voices in over 60 languages, with options tailored for commercial use.
5. **Voice Dream Reader** – Best for Mac and iOS users, offering 186 voices in 30 languages and compatibility with multiple cloud services.

The article also explains the difference between web-based TTS services and desktop software, discusses subscription models, and offers advice for integrating TTS into business workflows. Each software was rigorously tested based on performance, usability, voice quality, and pricing.

entries.title: Piotr Dabkowski
entries.snippet:
ElevenLabs, a rapidly growing AI startup co-founded by Polish entrepreneurs Piotr Dabkowski and Mateusz Staniszewski, has developed a state-of-the-art voice cloning technology. This tool allows users to generate lifelike voices from short audio samples and supports speech synthesis in 29 languages, making it highly useful for dubbing and voiceover applications. The company, just two years old, is already valued at $1.1 billion and has secured $80 million in funding from investors like Andreessen Horowitz. Major clients include HarperCollins, TIME, and the Washington Post.

The model stands out for its high quality, low latency, and robustness. Dabkowski notes that the technology is approaching a "quality ceiling," where AI-generated voices are indistinguishable from real human ones, raising ethical and security concerns. To address this, ElevenLabs has built-in safeguards such as credit card verification for access, audio generation tracking, and a speech classifier to detect AI-generated content. The company also participates in the U.S. AI Safety Institute's Consortium. Despite these efforts, some users have bypassed protections, emphasizing the ongoing challenge of preventing misuse in the rapidly evolving landscape of generative AI.

v.title: Espresso: A Fast End-to-end Neural Speech Recognition Toolkit
Common Voice: A Massively-Multilingual Speech Corpus
This Android App Can Help You Text Without Typing
v.snippet: The article discusses TalkType, a voice-first Android keyboard app developed by Baidu Research. Unlike traditional keyboard apps that default to a QWERTY layout, TalkType prioritizes voice input by presenting a prominent microphone icon. Upon tapping it, users can dictate messages that are then transcribed in real-time. The app also includes standard keyboard features like emoji, GIFs, and built-in restaurant search, plus a trackpad-like functionality for easier text editing. TalkType is praised for its voice recognition accuracy, even outperforming Apple’s default dictation in some cases and matching Google's. Baidu aims to leverage this app to refine its speech recognition technology, an essential step toward creating more effective AI assistants.

entries.title: Otter.ai's Sam Liang: We can unlock valuable data from meetings and conversations
entries.snippet:
Sam Liang, CEO of Otter.ai, outlines his vision for transforming business productivity through AI-driven meeting transcription and avatar technology. Founded in 2016, Otter.ai has grown from basic voice-to-text services to a comprehensive platform offering live transcription, searchable meeting archives, and AI chat tools. The company's next frontier is customizable AI avatars that can attend and participate in meetings on behalf of users by leveraging vast personal data like documents, emails, and past meeting transcriptions. While still in prototype, these avatars aim to emulate individuals and eventually represent them fully in both internal and customer interactions.

Liang emphasizes Otter’s proprietary AI and speech recognition technologies, vast meeting data, and platform-agnostic approach, which he believes give it an edge over Big Tech rivals and other start-ups. Otter has 20 million users and operates with a freemium model to penetrate enterprises from the ground up. Security and privacy are key concerns, with encrypted data storage and user-controlled sharing. Despite intensifying competition and concerns over AI “hallucinations,” Liang remains confident in Otter’s growth, citing improved model accuracy and strong user value, including saving users an average of four hours per week.

supporting_websites.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

## **Skeptical Notes**

- Not all tools give *consistent accuracy* across accents and noise — enterprise APIs usually outperform built-in dictation for messy real-world audio. citeturn0search0  
- Free options have limits (time, languages, file size). citeturn0search9  
- API pricing can grow fast at scale — check usage costs before committing.
